p: By gosh! Those were lovely letters! Got some real sleep last night, thanks to an electric pad, & today, for the first time, that sacro - iliac joint feels as though it is really healing. So I ought to be getting out of this trap during the next week. It's slow, but I feel sure now. It's not the pain, but the actual mechanical crippling, that I've cared about. The pain was all right in a queer-crazy way, that might not be so crazy either. I have not been unhappy. Mama has been an angel & it surely made her happy to keep me, I hate being waited on and jumped around for; but since it did make her much happier, it must have been good for her.

Still, I'll be damned it I like to see her doing everything. No boy to get anywhere. We've been very cozy - even during this sudden drop of temperature. Don't worry any more now. We've been truly happy together. I hate to lose time now, but that too may prove a good thing.

Floyd Mitchell, the Los Angeles agent, is eager to book me out there for next season, & probably this summer. He is the agent out there; and often inquiring around he said he got much more encouragement then he expected. We're dealing now. Mama & I should have a wow of a time in Calif. Might stay all winter with engagements strung along.
Ollie, I'm grateful for the offer. But as soon as I can sit up 7 hrs I can drive too. I'll come back fast as soon as the
joint is fairly healed. My general health has been better than usual, & there's no systemic trouble to prolong the sciatic nonsense.

Gillespie wants us to have his place out south on 65. He'd do almost anyway. It's a burden to him. We'll be at the ranch with them in early April. If he should make a ridiculously generous offer, involving, our place here, I might fall. He spen $30000, on the property. It is 6 miles beyond Hollister.
Nowadays you can't sell a gold brick for 30 cents a pound!
My Gawd, Ollie! Don't you think gehovah must be busting a gut with laughter, these days? An idiot couldn't invent so gorgeously silly a spectacle. But it's quite
all right with Gaki. Everything going as doped out some years back; and far be it from me to oppose the inevitable.
That joke hurt my back & leg, Ollie!!
Much better this A.M. Dressed for first time, but must be careful. I'll get out of the trap this week sure.
